original_solution_mapping.L1: She can buy 7 bags of candy because 7 / 1 = <<7/1=7>>7
original_solution_mapping.L2: She can buy 5 bags of chips because 7 / 1.4 = <<7/1.4=5>>5.
original_solution_mapping.L3: She gets 84 ounces of candy because 7 x 12 = <<7*12=84>>84
original_solution_mapping.L4: She gets 85 ounces of chips because 5 x 17 = <<5*17=85>>85
original_solution_mapping.L5: The gets 85 ounces in food because 85 > 84

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6419.
    Returns: the maximum number of ounces of food Amber can get.
    """
    # L1
    total_money = 7 # $7
    candy_bag_cost = 1 # $1
    num_candy_bags = total_money / candy_bag_cost

    # L2
    chips_bag_cost = 1.40 # $1.40
    num_chip_bags = total_money / chips_bag_cost

    # L3
    candy_ounces_per_bag = 12 # 12 ounces each
    total_candy_ounces = num_candy_bags * candy_ounces_per_bag

    # L4
    chips_ounces_per_bag = 17 # 17 ounces each
    total_chip_ounces = num_chip_bags * chips_ounces_per_bag

    # L5
    max_ounces = max(total_chip_ounces, total_candy_ounces)

    # FA
    answer = max_ounces
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: She can buy {num_candy_bags} bags of candy because {total_money} / {candy_bag_cost} = <<{total_money}/{candy_bag_cost}={num_candy_bags}>>{num_candy_bags}
She can buy {num_chip_bags} bags of chips because {total_money} / {chips_bag_cost} = <<{total_money}/{chips_bag_cost}={num_chip_bags}>>{num_chip_bags}.
She gets {total_candy_ounces} ounces of candy because {num_candy_bags} x {candy_ounces_per_bag} = <<{num_candy_bags}*{candy_ounces_per_bag}={total_candy_ounces}>>{total_candy_ounces}
She gets {total_chip_ounces} ounces of chips because {num_chip_bags} x {chips_ounces_per_bag} = <<{num_chip_bags}*{chips_ounces_per_bag}={total_chip_ounces}>>{total_chip_ounces}
The gets {max_ounces} ounces in food because {total_chip_ounces} > {total_candy_ounces}

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: She can buy 7 bags of candy because 7 / 1 = <<7/1=7>>7
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: She can buy 5 bags of chips because 7 / 1.4 = <<7/1.4=5>>5.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L3: She gets 144 ounces of candy because 12 x 12 = <<12*12=144>>144
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L4: She gets 85 ounces of chips because 5 x 17 = <<5*17=85>>85
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L5: The gets 144 ounces in food because 85 > 144

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'candy_ounces_per_bag' (value: 12) was used instead of 'num_candy_bags' (value: 7.0).
